page.title: 18LOVERSALL VILLAGE
page.content: Loversall village stands on a smaller hill north of Wadworth. The church at Loversall was built around 1100. It is situated like Wadworth church at the top of the hill. South east of the church is Loversall hall, it has seven and a half acres of grounds and was built around 1809 on the site of an earlier dwelling. It is now used by Colbear advertising. The Loversall water wheel was constructed in 1800. The 6 foot high Wheel is a breast wheel and was renovated in 1976 by Mr J Henderson. The main road has by passed the village but the bus service still goes through the centre. It remains a very small community with a small amount of new building.
